# tbcleanr
[![Travis build status](https://travis-ci.org/JayAchar/tbcleanr.svg?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.org/JayAchar/tbcleanr)
[![AppVeyor build status](https://ci.appveyor.com/api/projects/status/github/JayAchar/tbcleanr?branch=master&svg=true)](https://ci.appveyor.com/project/JayAchar/tbcleanr)
[![Coverage status](https://codecov.io/gh/JayAchar/tbcleanr/branch/master/graph/badge.svg)](https://codecov.io/github/JayAchar/tbcleanr?branch=master)


The goal of tbcleanr is to clean data generated by MSF OCA tools used to collect programmatic TB data. It has been designed with Epiinfo and Koch 6 options. 

## Installation

You can install the released version of tbcleanr from [Github](http://www.github.com/JayAchar) with:

``` r
library(devtools)
install_.packages_github("JayAchar/tbcleanr")
```
